intro: Gonolobus acuminatus, commonly known as the slender leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink and bloom in the early morning. Gonolobus acuminatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
